PhysicalExamExplanation: The decreased breath sounds on the left side observed in the physical examination may indicate a potential worsening of pneumonia or a related complication, which could conflict with the current prescription.
RevisedReason: The physical examination results suggest a potential complication related to pneumonia, which needs to be addressed to ensure the effectiveness of the treatment.
RevisedSuggestion: Consider adding a bronchodilator or pursuing further diagnostic imaging to evaluate the extent of pneumonia and possible pleural effusion.
RevisedPrescription: Levofloxacin (500 mg orally once daily for 7-14 days)
Nitroglycerin (0.4 mg tablet sublingually every 5 minutes as needed)
